title: Version 2 of Healthcare IT Must Change The Paradigm of EHRs
description: Version 2 of healthcare IT must change the paradigm of EHRs, not just the mechanism from paper to electronic.
body: Version 2 of healthcare IT must change the paradigm of EHRs, not just the mechanism from paper to electronic.

description: Efforts to involve consumers in care have missed the mark, pointing to shortcomings in the information used to develop initiatives.

title: Interoperable Health IT Infrastructure Key to Advancing Care

title: CMS Reviews Meaningful Use Rules for National Health IT Week
description: As a part of its activities for National Health IT Week, CMS is reviewing the requirements for meaningful use attestation in 2016.

title: In honor of health IT week, here are 10 of the biggest IT stories of the year so far
description: This year's National Health IT week runs Sept. 26-30. President Barack Obama said the week is a chance to recommit to improving healthcare using technologies and pursuing innovation. To celebrate the accomplishments, and acknowledge the remaining hardships, here is a look back on health IT this year.
body: This year's National Health IT week runs Sept. 26-30. President Barack Obama said the week is a chance to recommit to improving healthcare using technologies and pursuing innovation. To celebrate the accomplishments, and acknowledge the remaining hardships, here is a look back on health IT this year.

title: nThrive Partners with Vermont HITEC to Build Work-At-Home Workforce
More incubators emerging to aid HIT companies
description: Innovation to handle shifts in reimbursement is occurring widely, says Mike Biselli.

title: Value-based care becoming entrenched in healthcare
description: The radical change in market economics is well under way and irreversible, says Kevin Arner.

title: Success in value-based care requires unified tech approach

title: Are Lyft And Uber Coming To Healthcare?

title: Commentary: True care coordination essential for best outcomes in value-based system
description: While we have a ways to go, the value-based care model–combining the practice of population medicine with innovative payment models–has already resulted in better health, improved quality and lower costs for patients, providers and health plans.
body: While we have a ways to go, the value-based care model–combining the practice of population medicine with innovative payment models–has already resulted in better health, improved quality and lower costs for patients, providers and health plans.

title: Advisers face big challenges in helping clients prepare for health-care costs in retirement
description: Longevity, rising costs make preparing a solid health-care budget next to impossible. (Related read: Health-care costs squeeze retirement savings)
body: Longevity, rising costs make preparing a solid health-care budget next to impossible. (Related read: Health-care costs squeeze retirement savings)

title: Medicare audits ups 936% in last five years
description: Third party recovery audit contractors are harnessing the power of big data and analytics to dramatically grow their auditing capabilities, reports RACmonitor . Specifically, RAC auditors are using computerized techniques to pick targets for audits. This enabled auditors to increase the amount of audits they can perform by 936 percent.
body: Third party recovery audit contractors are harnessing the power of big data and analytics to dramatically grow their auditing capabilities, reports RACmonitor . Specifically, RAC auditors are using computerized techniques to pick targets for audits. This enabled auditors to increase the amount of audits they can perform by 936 percent.

title: What experts are doing to safeguard their institutions' data
description: As ransomware attacks become more prevalent and focused on healthcare organizations, security executives are ramping up protection efforts.
body: As ransomware attacks become more prevalent and focused on healthcare organizations, security executives are ramping up protection efforts.

title: "How do we protect the patient - without stifling innovation?"
description: (BJ-HC/ Vox Pop) Do apps and wearables have the potential to redefine healthcare delivery? John Dingley is that rare breed of healthcare provider and innovator - and passionate not only about ensuring quality of medical apps and so protecting his patients, but also supporting the innovation and creativity of fellow app developers.

description: If hospitals can't effectively respond to the increased financial pressures, more closures and consolidations may be expected.

title: Survey shows age divide in attitudes to health technology
description: Teva UK has unveiled findings of a survey showing a generational divide in attitudes to health and use of digital technologies. According to the survey, in which more than 1,000 people took part, those over the age of 55 years feel in high control of their health and are the most likely of any age group to feel its their responsibility to influence their own health.
body: Teva UK has unveiled findings of a survey showing a generational divide in attitudes to health and use of digital technologies. According to the survey, in which more than 1,000 people took part, those over the age of 55 years feel in high control of their health and are the most likely of any age group to feel its their responsibility to influence their own health.

title: Shift to paying physicians under MACRA has system CEOspreparing for complications
description: Anxiety is rippling through the healthcare industry as the initial reporting period for Medicare's new payment system for physicians fast approaches. Modern Healthcare's latest CEO Power Panel survey reveals leaders are bracing for uncertainties and challenges generated by MACRA.
body: Anxiety is rippling through the healthcare industry as the initial reporting period for Medicare's new payment system for physicians fast approaches. Modern Healthcare's latest CEO Power Panel survey reveals leaders are bracing for uncertainties and challenges generated by MACRA.

title: Roundtable: health care industry braces for issues related to cost, quality and the ACA
description: It's not as if the rising costs of health coverage went away, but for a few years the increases mitigated somewhat. That's changed of late...
